1 Statistics on membership within categories not available for these years,,
2
Includes individuals, relatively few in number, belonging to the Associa¬
tion c
3
Decrease in Associate membership and increase in Affiliate membership
largely a result of internal re-classification.
4 In October, 1956, the AERT was absorbed and its members became Indi¬
vidual members of the NAEB. At the same time, persons who had previously
belonged to the NAEB and had been classified as Affiliate members were
transferred into the new Individual category, resulting in a decrease in
the number of Affiliate members. Only an approximate figure can be given
lor the number of Individual members as of June 30, 1957 because tran¬
sition from AERT status to NAEB status had not been completed.
5
These two new categories of membership - Industrial Associate and Sus¬
taining member - were added within the past year. No concentrated
effort has yet been made to secure new members in these categories.
As of February 1959 there are three Industrial Associates.
